channel.title: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so

item.title: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so
item.dc:creator: @ringer24 ringer24
item.description:
@ringer24 wrote:

I see these people solved the problem. this is the line of code that allowed only the admin to use it…

if (command.startsWith("yell") && playerRights > 0) { 

 && playerRights > 0

^^ that is saying and playerRights are greater then 0 meaning.
that a normal player witch has a playerRights of 0 wont be able to use the command.

Read full topic
item.source: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so

item.title: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Is that command within a if(playerRights >= 2) or something like that? Cause I know that some people list their commands like this:

/////Admin Commands/////
if(playerRights >= 2) {

command1

command2

}

And so forth.

Read full topic

item.title: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so
item.dc:creator: @adamhelloman8 adamhelloman8
item.description:
@adamhelloman8 wrote:

Same as before.[quote=“Cuban0 Ftw, post:1, topic:273639”]if (command.startsWith("yell")) { String text = command.substring(5); yell("["+playerName+"] " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

What’s wrong with it, only owner can do it and no one else can?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so
item.dc:creator: @Cuban0_Ftw Cuban0 Ftw
item.description:
@Cuban0_Ftw wrote:

[code]private void customCommand(String command) {

if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && playerRights > 0) {
String text = command.substring(5);
yell("["+playerName+"] " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}[/code]

What’s wrong with it, only owner can do it and no one else can?

Read full topic
item.source: One more thing ::yell help, only owner can do so
